thread.title: US Senate Candidate Eldridge Has Raised More Than $400K
thread.title_full: US Senate Candidate Eldridge Has Raised More Than $400K

title: US Senate Candidate Eldridge Has Raised More Than $400K
text:
by Andrew DeMillo, The Associated Press on Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015 9:24 am Conner Eldridge 
LITTLE ROCK - Democratic U.S. Senate hopeful Conner Eldridge's campaign says he's raised more than $400,000 over the past month in his bid to unseat Republican Sen. John Boozman in Arkansas. 
Eldridge's campaign said Thursday that the former federal prosecutor raised more than $403,000 between announcing his campaign on Sept. 9 and the end of the latest fundraising quarter on Sept. 30. He has $400,761 cash on hand. 
Eldridge served as U.S. attorney for the Western District of Arkansas and stepped down in August preparing to launch his bid. 
Boozman was first elected to the Senate in 2010 and is seeking a second term. 
Eldridge is running in a state where Republicans have made major gains in recent elections tying Democrats to President Barack Obama, who remains deeply unpopular in Arkansas.
